intro: Pedicularis reynieri, commonly known as the Alpine Lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, typically pink or purple, which attract specific pollinators. Its leaves are often hairy and adapted to cold, nutrient-poor environments. Pedicularis reynieri is a short-lived perennial that thrives in rocky or sandy soils at high elevations.
